subject: RE: [junit] a test framework to codify levelizaton?
msgSnippet: ... What do you consider to be big ? I would love something to automate the running of the test cases as my co-workers are a bit unreliable when it comes to
messageBody:
"Ilja Preuss" <preuss@...> wrote on 20/07/2004 03:07:20 AM:

> I find the Continuous Testing plugin for Eclipse interesting:
> http://pag.lcs.mit.edu/~saff/continuoustesting.html
>
> It automatically runs the unit tests as part of the build process and
> can be configured to first run the recently failed tests.
>
> If you then split your project into a hierarchy of small modules (which
> I like to do, anyway), it could only run the tests of the modules that
> are affected by the current change.
>
> Sadly, the project isn't yet stable enough to be used in big
> workspaces... :(
>
> Cheers, Ilja

What do you consider to be "big"? I would love something to automate the
running of the test cases as my co-workers are a bit unreliable when it
comes to that (JUnit has had a slow takeup here :-(.

Michael Rutherfurd
